clinical_study.brief_title: Staphylococcal Acute Post-Operative PJI Treated With 'DAIR' And Impact Of Rifampin
clinical_study.official_title: Staphylococcal Acute Post-Operative Prosthetic Joint Infection Treated With 'DAIR' (Debridement and Implant Retention) And Impact Of Rifampin: A Retrospective Cohort Study In France

brief_summary.textblock: S. aureus and coagulase-negative staphylococci are the most frequent bacteria responsible for PJI (prosthetic joint infection). The aim of this study is to describe the use of rifampicin.

primary_outcome.measure: description of the use of rifampicin : rate of use
primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption)
primary_outcome.description: the aim is to determine how the use of rifampin influence the prognosis in staphylococcal acute post-operative prosthetic joint infection treated with DAIR

secondary_outcome.measure: rate of failure for treatment using rifampin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined by local clinical and/or microbiological relapse; and/or need for additional surgery; death of septic origin

secondary_outcome.measure: rate of adverse event with rifampin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption)
secondary_outcome.description: Description of adverses events leading to stop the rifampicin

arm_group.arm_group_label: Role of rifampin in staphylococcal PJI
arm_group.description: retrospective cohort study in 4 hospitals : patients with staphylococcal acute post-operative (< 1 month) PJI treated with DAIR in 2011-2016 period

intervention.intervention_name: Role of rifampin in staphylococcal PJI
intervention.description: the aim is to determine if the dose and the duration of rifampin influenced the prognosis
intervention.arm_group_label: Role of rifampin in staphylococcal PJI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
patients having had acute PJI (i.e. <1 month following the implantation), DAIR with exchange of removal components) due to S. aureus and coagulase-negative staphylococci (2011-2016)
Exclusion Criteria:
None
